DEFERIPRONE

  • Indications and doses
  • Drug action
  • Pregnancy

Indications and doses

Treatment of iron overload in patients with thalassaemia major in whom desferrioxamine is contraindicated or is inadequate,

By mouth

  • For adults
    25 mg/kg 3 times a day; maximum 100 mg/kg per day.

Drug action

Deferiprone, is an oral iron chelator.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid during pregnancy—teratogenic and embryotoxic in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises monitor liver function—interrupt treatment if persistent elevation in serum alanine aminotransferase.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Manufacturer advises caution—no information available.

Contra indications

  • History of agranulocytosis or recurrent neutropenia

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Agranulocytosis, arthropathy, blood dyscrasias, gastro-intestinal disturbances (reducing dose and increasing gradually may improve tolerance), headache, increased appetite, neutropenia, red-brown urine discoloration, zinc deficiency,

Advice for patients and carers

Blood disorders

Patients or their carers should be told how to recognise signs of neutropenia and advised to seek immediate medical attention if symptoms such as fever or sore throat develop.

Advice regarding conception and contraception

Manufacturer advises avoid before intended conception—teratogenic and embryotoxic in animal studies.

Contraception advised in females of child-bearing potential.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor neutrophil count weekly and discontinue treatment if neutropenia develops.

Monitor plasma-zinc concentration.

Unlicensed use

Not licensed for use in children under 6 years.

Prepared medicinal forms of DEFERIPRONE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral solution, oral suspension, capsule,
Tablet
Oral solution
